benchmark_details.name: TurBLiMP (Turkish Benchmark of Linguistic Minimal Pairs)
benchmark_details.overview: TurBLiMP is the first Turkish benchmark of linguistic minimal pairs, designed to evaluate the linguistic abilities of monolingual and multilingual language models, covering 16 linguistic phenomena with 1000 minimal pairs each.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of language model's syntactic capabilities for Turkish.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark currently includes only one paradigm per phenomenon and does not systematically test all model sizes.

data.source: Manually crafted and semi-automatically generated minimal pairs focused on Turkish linguistic phenomena.

methodology.calculation: Calculating sequence log probabilities for acceptable and unacceptable sentences.
methodology.interpretation: Human judgments were converted to z-scores to assess model performance relative to human acceptability ratings.
methodology.validation: 30 native Turkish speakers rated 216 sentences on a 7-point Likert scale.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collection was conducted anonymously with informed consent.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants provided informed consent prior to data collection.
